result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Matthew D Dickinson was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/Cost/DNA Surcharge to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing 07/01/2016 or penalty of 17 days Huber consecutive to any other sentence.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha City Police Department.
Huber with standard release conditions.  Defendant to report to Huber Facility by Thursday, May 26, 2016 at 6:00 p.m.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on the Dodge Ram ONLY.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

to exclude vehicle from ignition interlock filed by Attorney Bloch.
proposed to exclude vehicle from ignition interlock filed by Attorney Bloch.
Treatment

Defendant Matthew D Dickinson in court with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Bloch makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1. 
15 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  Defendant to report to Huber facility by Thursday May 26 at 6:00 pm. 
FINE:  $1492.00
DNA Surcharge: $200.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha Police Department.
Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing 7/1/2016 within 90 days. Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 17 days in Huber consecutive
DL REVOCATION:  12 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 12 months only for 1 motor vehicle, the Dodge Ram.  Order to exclude other vehicles signed.  
AODA Assessment and follow through
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Sentencing hearing on May 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew D Dickinson in court with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and Read in.  Count #3 is dismissed outright.  Court schedules sentencing.  Defendant to go to sheriff dept for ID processing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-25-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant Matthew D Dickinson in court.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended complaint given to the defendant by the State.  Defendant wishes to settle this matter.  Parties make statements.  Court has the defendant take more time to look into the offer.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing at 01-25-2016 10:30 am

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.

Defendant Matthew D Dickinson in court.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.
